subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: At first glance, it looked like any other major league tryout, but this one had a twist: the pitcher, Rinku Singh, had never picked up a baseball before May. And he is from India, better known for producing world-class cricketers than pitching aces. Singh and Dinesh Patel, both 19, pitched in front of some 30 major league scouts at a Tempe, Ariz., sports clinic. The tryout was among their rewards for winning an Indian reality TV show called “The Million Dollar Arm,” which drew more than 30,000 contestants.
